p:
From field observations, the main work tasks have varied workloads following these steps:
Material Procurement: The clay is mined and stored in the open.
Tempering: Clay is mixed with water to get the right consistency for molding. Mixing is done manually with hands and feet.
Molding: A lump of mix is taken, rolled in sand, and slapped into the metal mold.
Drying: The bricks are emptied onto the drying area, where they are dried in the sun. Every 2Â days, they are turned over to facilitate uniform drying.
Firing: The bricks are arranged in a kiln and insulation is provided with a mud-pack. Fire holes are ignited and the kiln is later sealed to keep the heat inside.
Sorting: After the kiln is disassembled, the bricks are sorted according to color. Color is an indication of the level of burning.
